Death timers don't allow that

According to the Wiki, death timers are calculated as Level \* 2.5 seconds + 7.5 seconds before the 15 minute mark.

So if the enemy team stayed level 1 (aka: decided to sit in base and not do anything at the first sign of trouble) their respawn times would be 10 seconds. 

So theoretically if Xerath started the game with enough damage to delete someone in a single Q that person on their own could die 60 times in 10 minutes, capping us at 300 deaths in 10 minutes for a full 5 man team being 100-0'd from second 1.

I've been hearing a lot about this, but what's actually even happening?

There's a script that let's a Xerath stand in their base and fire invisible, global Q's that hit 3 or 4 enemy champions at once, plus minions. Since he's in base he never dies, never really runs out of mana, and gets tons of kills/assists/CS, the games are over insanely fast.
so why has he not been removed until it gets fixed

This is almost only usable with a script.  If they disabled champions because of scripts, a good portion of all champions would be disabled.  Keeping him available also gets them more info on the script/bug, which will hopefully enable them to stop it eventually.

FYI there are scripts for most of the champions, they just aren't as noticeable as this one because this exploits a bug at the same time.  Without the script it is nearly impossible to use, so they are treating it as a script and banning players rather than disabling the champion.
